author: Chris Wright
title: Hellas Verona fan receives stadium ban for wearing swim trunks and flip flops
text:
about an hour ago Hellas Verona fan receives stadium ban for wearing swim trunks and flip flops 
One pioneering fan of Serie B side Hellas Verona has been handed a ban for the crime of turning up for a match while wearing a bathrobe, swimming trunks and a pair of flip flops. 
Indeed, the fan sported the aforementioned ensemble to watch Hellas play at Avellino's Stadio Partenio Lombardi on Feb. 11. 
According to Mediaset , he has since been issued with a DASPO (effectively a nationwide stadium ban), as it wasn't the hero of the hour's first offence. 
Rather amusingly, the as-yet unnamed supporter was previously reprimanded for donning a full ski outfit in the terraces for last month's home tie against Salernitana. Serie B: Hellas Verona Fan Given Stadium Ban After Turning Up To Match In Swimming Trunks And Flip-Flops (Photo) https://t.co/wUknEfubxq pic.twitter.com/XmRa0UJHpJ - Who Ate All The Pies (@waatpies) February 22, 2017 
In a week that has seen a rogue pie cost a man his job , it's perhaps refreshing to see that the Italian football authorities are just as curmudgeonly as their English counterparts. 
Chris covers the funny side of the game for ESPN FC in the Toe Poke blog.
